review.description: This truck is average.  I am a huge korean food fan, and this just wasn't that great.  The beef was too sweet--even for bulgogi/korean bbq.  The white rice was meh, and there was definitely not enough kimchi.  Compared to the bowl you can get at korrillabbq, this was a clear step down.  Plus, the 30 minute wait was not enjoyable.  If I'm going to wait that long, I will only do it for korilla, whose food kicks ass and is creative.   I found nothing creative about their bbq beef bowl.  So only 3 avg stars....
review.author: michael g.

review.description: This was probably the worse Korean food I ever had. I'm always on the lookout for food trucks and stumbled to see what the hype is all about and stumbled on this one in williamsburg one night. Hungry, I couldn't wait to give it a try. I ordered the tacos with 3 different meats (pork, chicken and bulgogi). It took forever for the order to be filled as I probably waited 25 min for the food. Considering that food trucks are supposed to be fast in service, this truck did not pass. There wasn't a line however, because of how slow the service was, the orders were adding up and the crowd began to gather around waiting for their food. I don't understand how they can service people quickly especially during lunch if they can't even handle things off hours. I can imagine them being overwhelmed and having impatient customers. Anyway, the food finally came and I devoured the tacos not because it was good, but because I was hungrier than ever over the wait. The meats all tasted exactly the same...salty. I expected the bulgogi to have more of the sweet flavor found in most korean bbq meats but I couldn't taste it. I couldn't tell the difference between the pork and chicken except for the texture. The portions were good though; each taco had a decent amount of meat and vegetables and I especially liked that they put 2 tortilla wraps on each taco so it doesn't break apart. Prices are decent but if the food isn't good, then what is the point?
review.author: sally w.
